Home has a garage so you can park car in a secure location which was is good. 3 Large TVâ€™s in the home, TV package provided in home could not get local channels so we couldnâ€™t watch local news, couldnâ€™t watch Sunday night football and could only watch items streamed from any services we already had accounts to like Netflix or Prime. review_text: We enjoyed our stay in quaint mid- city cottage by Ms. Brenda. It was well decorated and spotlessly clean. We had everything that we needed from kitchen and toilet essentials to fun card/board games for entertainment. We spent some fun times eating and playing card games and scrabble at the cozy kitchen nook. We slept good on fresh linens and comfortable beds. The outside of the house was very well kept. There was an outside seating great for bbq-ing while listening to the relaxing sound of the little pond beside it. The cottage was very well thought out and fits perfect for families visiting the town. The location of the cottage is easy to find and close to everything. There are restaurants (fast food/local resto/starbucks) and grocery stores (whole foods/trader joes/albertsons) within minutes. The host, Ms. Brenda is one of the kindest. She is quick to respond to any questions and willing to go above and beyond. We left some personal items at the cottage and without hesitations, she mailed it to us the next day. She is awesome! My family and I would definitely recommend this cottage. 10 stars out 5.

review_text: The house was everything we could expect and then some. It was very clean and welcoming with all the modern amenities. The hostess, Brenda, was very responsive to every question we had and made us feel very welcome. Many small touches like a jar full of biscottis, a drawer filled with Kuerig k-cups and many other little, thoughtful things made us feel at home. We also used the outdoor grill (which was very clean) for a great evening of food and fun. The outhouse where the laundry is located is a nice, cozy addition to the main house. The neighborhood was fantastic- residential, quiet and safe and yet with easy access to main roads to anywhere in the city. I highly recommend this place and would rent again if I went back to Baton Rouge.

name: John
rating_info:

Group trip
review_text:
This Mid-City Cottage is absolutely charming! It is the perfect house for a family visiting town. Great for all ages with the room off the patio with a doll house for kids that they will absolutely love hanging out in, to the lovely remodeled kitchen, to the comfortable beds and bedrooms. And the big back yard is perfect to play a game in or have the kids run around in.
Brenda went well out of her way to make our stay a very fun and satisfying one. She was nice enough to leave us a cooler as we had our son graduating from LSU and had a cookout the night before. She even hung a LSU flag for the occasion! Very nice touch! Geaux Tigers!
The house is well appointed with games, many cooking pots, pans, utensils, scissors tape, you name it - just about anything you would ever need. Never have we been so comfortable in a house that was not ours, although it sure felt so homey and comfortable. Truly, a home away from home! Coming all the way from Colorado, it was so pleasant and is the perfect location for everything Baton Rouge. We hope we can come back for a game in the future. We certainly will check with Brenda to see if her cottage is available!
To close, Brenda was so understanding when I booked - well over a year ago. Our older son was set to graduate in 2020 until the pandemic hit and canceled his graduation. I had booked a place for his graduation and it was painful to try and get a refund! Brenda was so understanding about my hesitancy and made me feel so secure with the process. After communicating with her, I had absolutely no hesitation booking. And cannot wait to book again.
Take care Brenda! John and Carrie
Thanks again Brenda! It was certainly our pleasure!

review_text:
This home is located in a quiet neighborhood and had such a cute and comfortable feel. It really felt like a charming home rather than just a rented house. You pull into a driveway for off street parking and walk through a gate to a lovely patio with outdoor table/chairs, a grill, and a swing! The entire house was very clean, well organized, and nicely decorated. This house is stocked with so many books....so maybe instead of packing your own, enjoy the selection while you visit. There is a dining nook with bench and chair seating able to accommodate quite a few people. The kitchen appears to be newly remodeled. One of the most impressive things about this place was the amount of cooking supplies. There were more than enough pots/pans/knives/plate/etc to make cooking a large meal easy. There are three bedrooms (two with queen beds and the third with two twins) all with very comfortable mattresses. One of the bedrooms has an attached bathroom and there is a second bathroom off the hallway. There were more than enough towels for everyone and bars of soap should you need it. Next to the house, off the patio is a charming little Free-standing studio room. There is a washer/dryer for guest use which was very helpful. This room also seems to be furnished for kids that may be traveling with you to have a separate space to play.
Overall, we were extremely impressed with the quality of this home, itâ€™s amenities, and the comfortable feel. The host is very responsive to communication.

review_text:
This is my favorite place to stay in Baton Rouge. I've booked it whenever I could while my child attended LSU. This cottage is comfy and feels like home. The owners have furnished it with cozy items without cluttering the space, as the pictures show. It's their special touches that really set this AirBnB apart -- like the Christmas decorations this month. They added a wreath on the door, plus a red throw and pillow on the porch chairs, and a mini christmas tree on the porch table. The living room mantle was decked in evergreen. A lighted Christmas tree lent a festive feel. In my arrival email, I happened to mention we were coming for LSU graduation ceremonies. There was an LSU balloon on the dining table and a congratulatory bottle of Prosecco in the refrigerator. Classy folk.
Cross the street to Zeeland St. Market for homemade breakfast, lunch and dinner. My favorite is the pecan smoked brisket or one of their unique salads. Dinner is elevated soul food!

I haven't seen anything better and that's why I booked it--and I wasn't disappointed. Anne Marie is also a good communicator and check-in was a breeze. I definitely recommend and will use this cottage again next time I am in town!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
BLUF: This is the best AirB&B location you will ever rent.
The house itself is so beautiful and has a wonderfully calming aesthetic. You will feel welcome and comfortable as soon as you walk through the door. On top of that, the whole home is very thoughtful in what it provides and where it is placed. I was impressed by the inclusion of a First Aid Kit in the kids' room, for example. The pictures posted are 100% accurate all the way down to the sheets on the bed and where the couch pillows are placed. This is a dream house.
Also, the house is perfectly located for having an authentic LSU-Baton Rouge experience. I earned both my Bachelor's and Law Degrees from LSU and was in town for an Alumni Tailgate event. So, I was already familiar with great places to get food and drink. This house is right across the street from Zeeland Cafe which is a great place to have a home-style breakfast or lunch, and is within walking distance of Garden District Coffee. Also, there are great restaurants and bars just over the Perkins overpass literally no more than three minutes away. It is also a five minute drive to campus, or cheap ride if you don't like to drive and park around campus like me. You are also close to Government Street that also has a lot of great restaurants and bars (like the new beer garden).
The cute little black kitten running around was also a nice bonus but not a part of the house.
Overall, it was an amazing experience. As soon as LSU puts out its 2022 football schedule I will immediately book this location again.

review_text: Anne Marie was a terrific host all-around. Although we did not have the chance to meet her, she was accommodating before, during, and after our trip. The check-in process was seamless, and she helped with catering suggestions, delivered a food cooler to the house when we asked for help providing food to an outdoor event, and was incredibly quick to respond to all our communication. The house is adorable, with beautiful artwork throughout the home. It is full of many thoughtful niceties such as laundry soap, coffee, and extra towels. We utilized the appliances (stove, fridge, washer/dryer), and all were clean and new. We found the location in a nice neighborhood and very close to a restaurant hub that kept us off the busy freeways at night. We didn't use the backyard, but it is enormous and has a nice outdoor seating area. The grandparents decided to join us last minute, and Anne Marie had no problem with that. There was also off-street parking for two cars. If we ever travel to Baton Rouge again, we will try to stay at Anne Marie's house.

Our pups enjoyed the huge yard, and although the home is located on a main street with through traffic, we felt confident our pups were safe & secured in the yard. We were pleasantly surprised at how quiet and peaceful this area was too once the brief work/school rush hour died down. The horseshoe driveway made it a breeze to close the gate & then exit on to the main road. In one direction, you are close to many of Baton Rougeâ€™s unique & delicious restaurants all around the Mid City area, but turn another direction, and you can easily get to Towne Center shopping & a Whole Foods. The home is absolutely beautiful, comfortable, & welcoming. We look forward to staying at Owenâ€™s place again!
